Vi ringede så og sagde vi ikke ville betale fuld pris da maden var kold og MEGA forsinket. Det ender så med deres chef ringede, os op og begynder at true og på livet. Vi får sushi fra Koma Sushi, når vi skal forkæle os selv. Sunrise menuen med 32 stykker for 269 kr. er genial, og stykkerne er selvfølgelig frisklavede. Dvs. der ligger ikke færdiglavede sushi-stykker i en køleboks ved disken, og de smager sprælfriskt. Vi fik wasabi, soya og ingefær med i boksen (inkluderet), og der var nok til to voksne og et 8-årigt barn. Ebi tempura roll med sprød tigerreje i pankorasp, chili-mayo og rogn er vildt god, og alle stykker er virkelig smukke.

A small family run sushi restaurant.  Not a wide variety of fish choices, but very tasty sushi and many choices of rolls.  Right in the downtown shopping district, so convenient for anyone exploring the city.  The owners were very accommodating and clearly take a lot of pride in their establishment.

Having tried Sushi in many countries, then I would rate this take away place as good. Fresh fish and newly made. We have got take away more times from Koma Sushi and its generally good. If you book on the web, just use the comment area to specify any special requirements and they are good to fulfill.
I will continue to order from this place as long as they keep this good standard.

I've had my share of sushi over the past years, and after spending a month in Japan i thought coming home to 'european sushi' would bring disappointing experiences. Koma Sushi offer very limited seating in the restaurant, and I would not recommend it as the take-away option is frequently used. The quality and taske is good, the service is fast.The price/experience ratio is excellent, but not cheap.

Vi så frem til at smage Jyrks Singapore style kylling burger men sikken en skuffelse, der var ingen smag af noget køkken, hverken det kereanske, japanske, malaysiske eller hvad de nu prøver at bilde os ind, vi har boet i Asien i 5 år, og har aldrig før smagt så dårlig en "efterligning". Helt klart en ommer, Hr. Jyrk skulle måske prøve lidt af de køkkener han omtaler.

For en "moden" mand på 60, er deres digitalbestilling no-go. Trods venlig hjælp fra personalet under de sidste 3 - 4 besøg, er det ikke lykkedes mig at knække koden. For et par dage siden stod jeg ved siden af en anden herre, der også havde disse problemer, og som spontant sagde: "Nu går jeg på BURGERKING, det er lettere og hurtigere" - jeg gjorde det samme! Jeg forestiller mig Macdonalds reaktion vil være - det er hurtigere for kunden - det er for at give bedre service - vi oplever det ikke som et problem - vi er glade for du finder hjælpen som venlig. Overskriften er, jeg gider ikke mere - BURGERKING fremover!

The scenery is absolutely spectacular and idyllic. The old and charming restaurant, which is a building dated back to the years around 1300, is located far out in the countryside where it is surrounded by stream, lakes and a dense forest.  

Unfortunately, this fist impression misleads you to think that the rest of the experience will be a beautiful. However, both the food and the service is nothing to write home about. 
 
The food is neither traditional Danish nor is it worth paying around 50 euro for (starter + main course).  The meat they served us was partially cold and a large part of it was un-chewable. 
The service was chocking. At the entrance we were met with annoyed staff because we asked, if it was possible to sit outside on their terrace instead.  The got even more annoyed when we asked if it was possible to put an extra chair to the table, so we could all sit together. A detail worth mentioning is that we were the only dining guests sitting on the terrace, which could easily fit 40-50 people more.  So, I do not believe we would bother anyone by placing an extra chair next to our table.  When it came to ordering, we were met with impatiens and irritation because we had questions regarding the food and their selection of special beers. Short and imprecise answers followed by a sigh, is not what you expect from such a place. 

My suggestion to future visitors is:  Go to Pøt Mølle, have a coffee or a water, walk around the small lake and then leave.

The scene is set for a lovely dining evening with both the outside and inside settings being very cosy and romantic. 
Having said that I believe they have to step up a bit on the service (not that it was bad just needed some inspiration as well as the food) to get a better grade. 
It was also a bit chilly. 

Having said that I do recommend dining here.
Great food and service, a bit on the expensive side for a UK visitor and menu only in Danish but very good.
